p: Physical and behavioural examination revealed no adverse effects on mice given 400 mg/kg/day and 2000 mg/kg/day when compared to the control group ( Figure 3). However, all animals treated with a dose up to a maximum gained weight ( p > 0.05). These results could indicate that the administration of leaf extract of W. frutescens up to 2000 mg/kg/day to mice for 28 days has no adverse effect on physical appearance and body weight. Food and water consumption by animals receiving the extract studied was not directly affected when compared to the control group ( p > 0.05). This finding agrees with other data, which showed that humans taking the aqueous extract of Withania somnifera gained weight and appetite [ 13, 23].
